{-# LANGUAGE LambdaCase, TemplateHaskell, TypeFamilies, OverloadedStrings, ViewPatterns #-}
{-# OPTIONS_GHC -funbox-strict-fields #-}

module OnPing.DataServer.Handler (
    -- * Server global state
    ServerState (..)
    -- * Types
  , DecodedData
  , Counter
  , LiveValue (..)
    -- * Yesod handler
    -- | The 'Handler' monad. Server actions
    --   are performed here.
  , Handler
  , GlobalVar
  , createGlobalVar
    -- * Manipulating the state
    -- ** Primitive actions
  , get
  , modify
    -- ** Composed actions
  , addDecoded
    -- ** Request handlers
  , getTransferR
  , putDeleteChunkR
  , putInsertChunkR
    -- * Other Yesod Stuff
  , Widget
  , resourcesGlobalVar
  ) where

-- Base
import Control.Monad (when)
import Data.String (fromString)
import Data.Char (isDigit)

-- Maps
import Data.IntMap (IntMap)
import qualified Data.IntMap.Lazy   as LM
import qualified Data.IntMap.Strict as SM

-- Binary list stuff
import Data.BinaryList.Serialize (Decoded)
import qualified Format.BinaryStore as BS

-- ByteString's
import Data.ByteString.Lazy (ByteString)
import qualified Data.ByteString.Lazy as B

-- Yesod
import Yesod ( mkYesod, parseRoutesFile
             , Yesod, getYesod
             , renderRoute
             , liftIO
             , TypedContent (..), toContent
             , sendResponse, sendResponseStatus
             , addHeader
             , waiRequest
               )
import Network.Wai (lazyRequestBody)
import Network.HTTP.Types.Status
         ( badRequest400
         , notFound404
         , internalServerError500
         , notImplemented501
         , serviceUnavailable503
           )

-- Concurrency
import Control.Concurrent.MVar

-- Away server (client interface)
import OnPing.DataServer.AwayServer

-- Aeson (JSON)
-- import Data.Aeson (Value)

-- System
import System.FilePath (takeDirectory)
import System.Directory
         ( doesFileExist
         , doesDirectoryExist
         , removeFile
         , createDirectoryIfMissing
         , getDirectoryContents
           )
import System.IO.Error (catchIOError)

------------------------------------------------
-- Server Global State

-- | Decoded data with holes.
type DecodedData = Decoded (Maybe Double)

-- | The counter specifies the age of some live
--   data. Live data is data kept in memory for
--   quick access.
--
--   The counter has two limits:
--
--   * /First limit:/ After this limit is reached,
--     live data is dropped from the global state,
--     but the counter keeps growing. Therefore,
--     the counter will stay in memory.
--
--   * /Second limit:/ After this limit, the file
--     pointed by the 'Key' is sent to S3. The
--     counter is removed from memory as well.
--
type Counter = Int

-- | A live value in memory. It might or might not
--   contain decoded data ('lvData'). If it does
--   not contain the decoded data, it can be read
--   from the local disk. The counter ('lvCounter')
--   tells you how much time this value has been
--   on memory. See 'Counter'.
data LiveValue = LiveValue
  { -- | Length index (see 'BL.lengthIndex') of
    --   decoded data at full resolution.
    lvLength  :: !Int
    -- | Decoded data in memory.
  , lvData    ::  Maybe DecodedData
    -- | Counter.
  , lvCounter :: !Counter
    }

-- | The server global state.
data ServerState = ServerState
  { -- | 'IntMap' of live data. The first key is the PID
    --   of an user. If a PID is not present, there is no
    --   live data of that user. You should look at the
    --   'AwayServer'. The second key (key of the inner
    --   map) refers to the initial time of the data in a
    --   binary store. Depending on the usage of the data,
    --   initial times will vary.
    --
    --   /Live value maps should be manipulated strictly, while live/
    --   /values should be manipulated lazily./
    liveData :: IntMap (IntMap LiveValue)
    -- | Server to send the old data.
  , awayServer :: AwayServer
    }

------------------------------------------------
-- Yesod templating

-- | Type of the global variable holding the server state.
newtype GlobalVar = GlobalVar { unGlobalVar :: MVar ServerState }

mkYesod "GlobalVar" $(parseRoutesFile "data-server-routes")

instance Yesod GlobalVar where

------------------------------------------------
-- Global Variable creation

isNumber :: String -> Bool
{-# INLINE isNumber #-}
isNumber = all isDigit

-- | Map a function over a list and filter out the 'Nothing'
--   values.
mapFilterM :: Monad m => (a -> m (Maybe b)) -> [a] -> m [b]
mapFilterM f = go
  where
    go (x:xs) = do
      my <- f x
      ys <- go xs
      return $ case my of
        Just y -> y : ys
        _ -> ys
    go  _ = return []

createGlobalVar :: AwayServer -> IO GlobalVar
createGlobalVar server = do
  b <- doesDirectoryExist "data"
  m <- if b then generateLiveData else return SM.empty
  v <- newMVar $ ServerState 
    { liveData = m
    , awayServer = server
      }
  return $ GlobalVar v

-- TODO: add comments to this function!
generateLiveData :: IO (IntMap (IntMap LiveValue))
generateLiveData = do
  xs <- getDirectoryContents "data"
  let pids = fmap read $ filter isNumber xs
  ps <- mapM (\pid -> do
                 ys <- getDirectoryContents $ "data/" ++ show pid
                 let tsfps = filter isNumber ys
                 lvs <- mapFilterM (\tfp -> do
                                       let fp = "data/" ++ show pid ++ "/" ++ tfp
                                       fl <- B.readFile fp
                                       case BS.decode fl of
                                         Left err -> do
                                           putStrLn $ "File (" ++ fp ++ ") does not contain "
                                                   ++ "a valid binary store: " ++ err
                                           return Nothing
                                         Right bs -> return $ Just
                                           ( read tfp
                                           , LiveValue (fromIntegral $ BS.bsLength bs)
                                                       -- Now that we have read the file...
                                                       -- Why not keeping in memory what we
                                                       -- have read so far?
                                                       (Just $ BS.readBinaryStore bs)
                                                       0
                                             )
                                      ) tsfps
                 return (pid, LM.fromList lvs)
                             ) pids
  return $ SM.fromList ps

------------------------------------------------
-- Manipulating the state

-- | Perform an action using the global variable.
withVar :: (MVar ServerState -> IO a) -> Handler a
{-# INLINE withVar #-}
withVar f = getYesod >>= liftIO . f . unGlobalVar

-- | Read the current global state.
get :: Handler ServerState
{-# INLINE get #-}
get = withVar readMVar

-- | Modify the current state. The global state will
--   be blocked from reading (see 'get') while this
--   operation is performed.
modify :: (ServerState -> ServerState) -> Handler ()
{-# INLINE modify #-}
modify f = withVar $ \v -> takeMVar v >>= putMVar v . f

{-

Note that there is no 'put' operation in the Server monad.
This is because the underlying MVar is /always/ full (except
if it's in the middle of a 'modify' call). A 'put' operation
would therefore result in a block.

-}

-- | Add 'DecodedData' to memory (global state).
addDecoded :: Int -- ^ PID
           -> Int -- ^ Initial time
           -> Int -- ^ Length index of decoded data at full resolution.
           -> Maybe DecodedData -- ^ Decoded data.
           -> Handler ()
{-# INLINE addDecoded #-}
addDecoded pid t l dd = modify $
  \st ->
     let lv = LiveValue l dd 0
     in  st { liveData = SM.alter
                (\case
                    Just m  -> Just $ LM.insert t lv m
                    _       -> Just $ LM.singleton t lv
                 ) pid $ liveData st }

-- | Remove a live value from memory.
removeLiveValue :: Int -- ^ PID
                -> Int -- ^ Initial time
                -> Handler ()
{-# INLINE removeLiveValue #-}
removeLiveValue pid t = modify $
  \st -> st { liveData = SM.alter (fmap $ LM.delete t) pid $ liveData st }

------------------------------------------------
-- Utils

-- | Write a file and any parent directories if needed.
writeFilePlus :: FilePath -> ByteString -> IO ()
writeFilePlus fp bs = do
  let d = takeDirectory fp
  createDirectoryIfMissing True d
  B.writeFile fp bs

------------------------------------------------
-- Requests

binaryContent :: ByteString -> TypedContent
binaryContent = TypedContent "binary/octet-stream" . toContent

-- | Send a chunk of data to the requester. It sends a 404 response
--   if the chunk can't be found. If not found in the server, it
--   will ask to the configured 'AwayServer'. The 404 response contains
--   an error description in its body. Otherwise (200 response), the
--   body contains the chunk in binary format.
--
--   When the transference is accomplished, the response might be
--   delayed by some seconds. This is because the server must make
--   sure that - in case that the chunk was retrieved from the away
--   server - the chunk no longer stays stored at the away server,
--   thus avoiding conflicting copies to roll around. If, after a fixed
--   number of tries, the file from the away server is not deleted,
--   this server will stop trying and will report an error. However,
--   even if an error is reported, the transferred data will still
--   be included in the response body. A 200 response means that everything
--   worked as expected. A 500 response means that the deletion on the
--   away server failed. The details will be prompted in the server,
--   and the HTTP response will contain the error in a @X-Error@ header.
--
--   If a transference is done from an away server, but the data transferred
--   was found corrupt, a 501 response will be sent, with the response body
--   describing the error.
getTransferR :: Int -- ^ PID
             -> Int -- ^ Initial time
             -> Handler TypedContent
getTransferR pid t = do
  st <- get
  case SM.lookup pid (liveData st) >>= LM.lookup t of
    -- Chunk is not present in local disk
    Nothing -> do
      -- Ask away server
      transr <- liftIO $ clientTransfer (awayServer st) pid t
      case transr of
        -- Not found
        TransferNotFound -> sendResponseStatus notFound404 ()
        -- Some error
        TransferError err -> sendResponseStatus internalServerError500 err
        -- Found in away server!
        TransferFound b -> do
          -- Check that it is well encoded (required to extract length).
          -- There is no problem about doing this since only the header
          -- needs to be read.
          case BS.decode b of
            -- Error decoding. This should NEVER happen. If it does...
            Left err -> do
              -- Print error in server
              liftIO $ putStrLn $ "getTransferR: Error retrieving ("
                               ++ show (awayServer st)
                               ++ ") chunk: " ++ err
              -- Send 501 response with error in the body
              sendResponseStatus notImplemented501 err
            Right bs -> do
              -- Write it to local disk
              liftIO $ writeFilePlus (generateFilePath pid t) b
              -- Add it to memory
              addDecoded pid t (fromIntegral $ BS.bsLength bs) Nothing
              -- Once written, ask (please) to away server to
              -- remove it
              res <- liftIO $ clientDeleteChunkPlease (awayServer st) pid t 10
              case res of
                -- Send OK response with the binary content
                Right True -> sendResponse $ binaryContent b
                Right False -> do
                  -- Print error in server
                  liftIO $ putStrLn $ "getTransferR: Could not delete chunk from "
                                   ++ show (awayServer st)
                  -- Send ERROR response with the binary content
                  addHeader "X-Error" "System error"
                  sendResponseStatus internalServerError500 $ binaryContent b
                Left err -> do
                  -- Print error in server
                  liftIO $ putStrLn $ "getTransferR: Error deleting ("
                                   ++ show (awayServer st)
                                   ++ ") chunk: " ++ err
                  -- Send ERROR response with the binary content
                  addHeader "X-Error" $ fromString err
                  sendResponseStatus internalServerError500 $ binaryContent b
    -- Chunk is in local disk!
    _ -> do
        -- Just read the file...
        b <- liftIO $ B.readFile $ generateFilePath pid t
        -- ... and send it over :)
        sendResponse $ binaryContent b

-- | Delete a chunk of data from the server, removing it
--   from both memory and local disk. If it does not exist,
--   this does nothing and reports success.
putDeleteChunkR :: Int -- ^ PID
                -> Int -- ^ Initial time
                -> Handler ()
putDeleteChunkR pid t = do
  st <- get
  case SM.lookup pid (liveData st) >>= LM.lookup t of
    -- Chunk is in local disk
    Just _ -> do
      -- Remove value from memory
      removeLiveValue pid t
      -- Delete file (catching any IOError)
      res <- liftIO $ catchIOError
               (do let fp = generateFilePath pid t
                   b <- doesFileExist fp
                   when b $ removeFile fp
                   return Nothing)
               (return . Just)
      case res of
        -- Error removing file! Report the error and let the
        -- client decide if it wants to try again.
        Just err -> sendResponseStatus serviceUnavailable503 $ show err
        _ -> sendResponse ()
    -- Chunk is not present in local disk (nothing to do)
    _ -> sendResponse ()

-- | Insert a chunk received from a client request. It returns a 400 response
--   if the header of the chunk is malformed. In that case, the body of the
--   response will contain the error. Otherwise, a 200 response is sent.
putInsertChunkR :: Int -- ^ PID
                -> Int -- ^ Initial time
                -> Handler ()
putInsertChunkR pid t = do
  b <- waiRequest >>= liftIO . lazyRequestBody -- Network.Wai
  case BS.decode b of
    Left err -> sendResponseStatus badRequest400 err
    Right bs -> do
      -- If the header is fine, write the file (this will consume the
      -- full bytestring)
      liftIO $ writeFilePlus (generateFilePath pid t) b
      -- Once is written, it is safe (and necessary) to add it to
      -- the memory.
      addDecoded pid t (fromIntegral $ BS.bsLength bs) Nothing
      sendResponse ()
